definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: She bent to touch the leaves of a plant or to smell a flower.
sentences.chinese: 她弯下腰去触摸植物的叶子或花的气味。

sentences.english: Images of winter trees have no leaves and white backgrounds because of the snow.
sentences.chinese: 冬天的树图没有叶子，而且因为雪呈现白色的背景。

sentences.english: Use a lighter to burn a hole in the middle of each Scindapsus aureus leaf.
sentences.chinese: 把一盆绿萝的叶子中央都用打火机烧一个洞。

sentences.english: And there's something on that grass that cures that blood disease.
sentences.chinese: 草叶子上面的什么东西就把她的血液病给治好了。

sentences.english: The trees in the park are all leaving out now.
sentences.chinese: 现在公园里的树都长出叶子了。

sentences.english: Cut out the leaf rubbings with scissors.
sentences.chinese: 用剪刀将叶子拓片剪下。

sentences.english: Amused, the shopkeeper asked what I wanted this alleged green leaf for.
sentences.chinese: 菜店老板就很开心地问我要这种绿色的叶子做什么用。

sentences.english: The leaves are beginning to wilt.
The coffee plant is really a small tree with shiny leaves.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡这种植物其实是一种有着闪光的叶子的矮树。

sentences.english: With this thought he cheerfully climbed onto the greenest leaf.
sentences.chinese: 这样想着他高兴地爬上了一片最绿的叶子。

sentences.english: Deeds are fruits, words are but leaver.
sentences.chinese: 行动时果实，言语只是叶子。

sentences.english: The plant is leafing out in the summer sun.
sentences.chinese: 这株植物在夏日的日光中长叶子。

sentences.english: In the fall, the leaves of both types turn a brilliant red.
sentences.chinese: 在秋天这两种叶子会变成鲜艳的红色。

sentences.english: It was calm and not a leaf moved .
sentences.chinese: 平静得连一片叶子也没有动。

sentences.english: Nettle cloth is as good as linen cloth.
sentences.chinese: 荨麻在嫩时，叶子是一种非常好吃的蔬菜。

definition: venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
variant of 枝椏|枝桠[zhi1 ya1]
